CurrencyParameter.name: currency
CurrencyParameter.description: Please provide at least one of the following query params: currency, railType. Eg. Setting 'currency' to 'usd' without setting 'railType' and 'paymentRail' will return all usd accounts under any railType or paymentRail.

financialInstitute.description:
The financial institute of the account. Financial institue type has to match the accountType. eg. accountType of bank requires financialInstitute of bank.
Look at the list of supported combination of `country`, `currency`, and `financialInstitute` [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QxAWGoZMznB6_Ts4mzFcFD49ZOMUZNdNiR6wlr8NDL0/edit?gid=293141391#gid=293141391).
Make sure the `financialInstitute` enum is supported under the `country` and `currency`.

currency.description:

Make sure the `currency` enum is supported under the `country` and `financialInstitute`.

country.description:

iban.description: EU international bank account number. Required if `bank.accountNumber` is not provided.

address.description: account holder address as recorded by the bank

govIdType.description:
account holder government ID type.

Certificate type:
  `00` = Chinese Mainland ID Card
  `01` = Chinese Mainland Residence Permit
  `02` = Passport
  `03` = Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan ID Card
  `04` = Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan Residence Permit
  `05` = Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan Exit-Entry Permit
  `06` = Non-Chinese ID Card
  `07` = Non-Chinese Residence Permit

type.description:
type of recipient.

  `00` UBO (`bank.accountName` must match the user's KYC name)
  `10` Supplier other
  `11` Supplier procurement
  `12` Supplier logistics
  `13` Supplier advertising
  `14` Supplier warehousing
  `15` Supplier operation agent
  `16` Supplier freelancer
  `20` General other
  `21` General freelance
  `22` General employee
  `23` General platform user
  `24` General remittance

occupation.description:
recipient occupation code. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.
[Here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/occupation-code) is the list of occupation codes.

certificationType.description:
recipient certification type. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

Certificate type:
  `00` = Chinese Mainland ID Card
  `01` = Chinese Mainland Residence Permit
  `02` = Passport
  `03` = Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan ID Card
  `04` = Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan Residence Permit
  `05` = Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan Exit-Entry Permit
  `06` = Non-Chinese ID Card
  `07` = Non-Chinese Residence Permit

certificationNumber.description: recipient certification number. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

certificationFrontUrl.description: recipient certification front URL. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

certificationBackUrl.description: recipient certification back URL. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

certificationIssuanceDate.description: recipient certification issuance date. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

certificationExpirationDate.description: recipient certification expiration date. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

certificationIssuanceAuthority.description: recipient certification issuance authority. Required when `recipient.type` is `24`.

bank.description: Bank account details to use when making payments.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the request (recommend using uuid v4).

type.description:
type of transfer.

`PAYOUT` = general payment
`SUPPLIER` = non-CNY supplier payment 
`INTERNAL_TRANSFER` = internal transfer

paymentNetwork.description:
payment network. not required when `type` = `INTERNAL_TRANSFER`.

**LOCAL:** ACH, FPS, RTGS, FedWire, Bpay, SEPA

**CROSS-BORDER:** SWIFT

rateId.description:
Rate ID.

Required only when `source.currency` and `destination.currency` are different.

feeBearer.description:
fee bearer. When making transfer, you must confirm who will pay the transfer fees.

`SHA` - The transfer fees are shared. The payer will pay the charges from HIFI. The recipient bears the charges of the intermediary banks and their bank, which will be deducted from the remittance amount, and your recipient will receive the remaining balance. (Only available for `CROSS-BORDER` `SWIFT` payouts)

`OUR` - The payer pays all transfer fees in full before initiating the transfer. This means that the amount will be delivered to the recipient in full.

For LOCAL transfers, `OUR` is the only option.

pobo.description:
Use pay on behalf of(POBO) service?
If `true`, the transfer will be made on behalf of the user's KYC name. Default is `false`.

purpose.description: payment purpose code. [Here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/payment-purpose-code) is the list of payment purpose codes.

documents.description:
document URLs.

When `purpose` = `3005`-Salary, you can upload Employment Contract + Proof of Overseas Residence.
When the single transaction amount exceeds 50,000 USD, an additional Tax return Certification should be uploaded.
When `purpose` = `3007`-Living expenses/Family support, you could upload Screenshot of Household Register + Proof of Overseas Residence.

userId.description: User ID. Funds will be deducted from this user.

amount.description:
Transfer payment amount.

Either `source.amount` or `destination.amount` must be provided, but not both. 
If `source.amount` is provided, the `destination.amount` will be calculated based on the `source.amount` and the exchange rate (if the `source.currency` and `destination.currency` are different).

currency.description: Transfer payment currency. See the full list of collection currencies by bank location [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/currencies-by-bank-location).

userId.description:
User ID.

Either `destination.userId` or `destination.recipientId` must be provided, but not both. 
`destination.userId` must be provided if the transfer `type` is `INTERNAL_TRANSFER`.

recipientId.description:
Recipient ID returned by the Create a transfer recipient endpoint.

Either `destination.userId` or `destination.recipientId` must be provided, but not both. 
`destination.recipientId` must be provided if the transfer `type` is not `INTERNAL_TRANSFER`.

amount.description:
Destination recieved amount.

Either `source.amount` or `destination.amount` must be provided, but not both. 
If `destination.amount` is provided, the `source.amount` will be calculated based on the `destination.amount` and the exchange rate (if the `source.currency` and `destination.currency` are different).

currency.description: Destination recieving currency. See the full list of payout currencies and channels by region [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/docs/payment-currencies-and-channels-by-region).

govIdFrontUrl.description:
URL or Base64 encoded string of the front of the user's government issued ID.

*Maximum file size 3MB and minimum file size 10KB

*If the file is base64 encoded, it must start with "data:"

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

govIdBackUrl.description:
URL or Base64 encoded string of the back of the user's government issued ID.

*Maximum file size 3MB and minimum file size 10KB

*If the file is base64 encoded, it must start with "data:"

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

govIdHandHoldUrl.description:
URL or Base64 encoded string of image of the user holding their government issued ID next to their face.

*Maximum file size 3MB and minimum file size 10KB

*If the file is base64 encoded, it must start with "data:"

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

govIdCountry.description:
Alpha-3 country code of the provided government id as defined in the ISO 3166-1 spec. Note that the government ID may be different from the 'country' above.

(See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/geographic-restrictions-for-user-creations) for the list of unsupported countries/states.)

purpose.description:
The purposes for unlocking this rail. Multiple values can be put into an array. Only required for `MULTI_CURRENCY_ACCOUNT` rail. 

Look up the purpose code [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/account-purpose).

productServiceCategory.description:
The category of the product or service the user is in. Only required for `MULTI_CURRENCY_ACCOUNT` rail.

Look up the product and service category code [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/product-and-service-category).

supplementaryInfo.description: This field allows the inclusion of additional textual information or context that may be relevant to the KYC process.

supplementaryUrl.description:

URL or Base64 encoded string of the file of the supplementary information.

*Maximum file size 3MB and minimum file size 10KB

*If the file is base64 encoded, it must start with "data:"

*Valid file types: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .heic, .tif

leiNumber.description:
Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) is a 20-character alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a legal entity participating in financial transactions.
LEI is required for businesses based in the European Economic Area (EEA) and Switzerland.

stateProvinceRegion.description:
The second part of the [ISO 3166-2 subdivision code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2). This must be provided if the country has subdivisions.

An ISO 3166-2 code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen (`-`):
  1. The first part is the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country (e.g., `US`, `CA`, `BR`);
  2. The second part is a string of up to three alphanumeric characters representing a specific subdivision (e.g., state, province). This is typically based on national standards or developed by ISO.

  Only provide the second part of the code (e.g., `CA` for California in `US-CA`, or `SP` for São Paulo in `BR-SP`).

`INITIATED` - Deposit is initiated.
`PENDING` - Deposit has been received and am currently going through review.
`COMPLETED` - Deposit review has been approved and completed.
`CANCELED` - Deposit has been cancelled.
`CLOSED` - Deposit have been rejected and may be resubmitted.
`REJECTED` - If the deposit is rejected, the corresponding deposit flow cannot be initiated again.
`REFUNDED` - Deposit has been rejected, and a refund has been made.

balance.description: The raw balance of the wallet expressed in the smallest denomination of the token. This format is ideal for backend calculations, automation processes, or when precise, unrounded figures are necessary for smart contract interactions. For example, use this when calculating transaction fees or performing token transfer operations that require exact values.

displayBalance.description: The wallet balance formatted as a decimal string for display purposes, adjusted according to the token's decimal places to facilitate human readability. This format is best used in user interfaces where balances are displayed to end-users, such as in wallet apps or dashboards, where readability and familiarity are crucial. For instance, displaying an account balance on a user's home screen or summary page.

post.description:
Create a recipient for an external transfer. Before initiating an external transfer, you must create a recipient and ensure their KYC review status is `AVAILABLE`.

The recipient's required KYC and bank details vary based on regional AML (anti-money laundering) regulations and the selected payment channel. You can find details on supported transfer currencies and payment channels by region [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/payment-currencies-and-channels-by-region).

In the production environment, a manual compliance audit is triggered if recipient.type is 2X. The system checks the compliance audit status approximately every ten minutes.

Once the review is complete, the recipient status will update to either `AVAILABLE` or `DECLINED`.

get.description: Get a list of all recipients.

post.description:
Update the information of an existing recipient. Any updated recipient will undergo KYC process again.

The recipient's required KYC and bank details vary based on regional AML (anti-money laundering) regulations and the selected payment channel. You can find details on supported transfer currencies and payment channels by region [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/payment-currencies-and-channels-by-region).

In the production environment, a manual compliance audit is triggered if recipient.type is 2X. The system checks the compliance audit status approximately every ten minutes.

Once the review is complete, the recipient status will update to either `AVAILABLE` or `DECLINED`.

get.description: Get the details of a recipient.

post.description: Create a transfer from a Multi-Currency Account to an external recipient or another Multi-Currency Account owned by a different user within your organization.

post.description:
Obtain a foreign exchange (FX) rate for currency conversions within the user's Multi-Currency Account.

* The exchange rate is valid for 60 seconds only.
Exchange currencies by creating a foreign exchange (FX) order. To do so, you must first obtain an FX rate and execute the FX order within its validity period (60s).

post.description:
Update the user's KYC information.

The Update KYC endpoint allows you to add or modify the user's existing KYC data. This is the only endpoint available for making changes to the user's KYC information.

HIFI does not provide services to users or businesses from sanctioned and high-risk regions or unsupported US states. See [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/geographic-restrictions-for-user-creations) for supported regions.

get.description: Get the KYC information the user currently holds.

Get the required and optional KYC fields for a specific rail, along with any invalid KYC fields currently held by the user for unlocking the rail.

The Get KYC Requirements endpoint provides a comprehensive list of required and optional KYC fields needed to initiate a KYC submission (the same set of info available in our [KYC Requirements doc](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/kyc-rails-requirements)). 
Additionally, it identifies any invalid fields in the user's current KYC data that need to be updated before submission. This is particularly useful for pre-filling KYC forms and addressing issues proactively.

This endpoint is intended **only** for use **before** KYC submission. After submitting KYC data, use the [Get KYC Status](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/reference/get_v2-users-userid-kyc-status) endpoint to check the submission status and further identify any fields that may still require updates.

post.description:
Submit the user's current KYC data to unlock a specific rail. Any updates to the user's KYC data prior to submission should be made using the [Update KYC](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/reference/post_v2-users-userid-kyc) endpoint.)      

The KYC data will only be submitted if all the required KYC fields for the rail are provided. If any required fields are missing, no submission will occur, and the user must supply the missing information using the [Update KYC](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/reference/post_v2-users-userid-kyc) endpoint.

A successful submission is confirmed when the response includes a KYC status object. If no such object is returned, the submission did not occur.

For more details on required and optional KYC fields for unlocking each rail, visit our [KYC Rails Requirement page](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/kyc-rails-requirements).
To learn more about KYC, our KYC endpoints, and an example flow for unlocking a rail, see our [KYC Overview page](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/kyc-overview).

get.description:
Get the user's latest KYC status for a specific rail after a KYC submission. If no KYC submission has been made for the rail, it will have an `INACTIVE` status.

The Get KYC Status endpoint provides the current KYC status of a rail, including details on any invalid or incomplete fields that may require updates. 
To address any invalid or incomplete fields, use the [Update KYC endpoint](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/reference/post_v2-users-userid-kyc), and then resubmit the data using the [Submit KYC endpoint](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/reference/post_v2-users-userid-kyc-submissions).
List all KYC statuses based on the provided filters.

post.description:
Generate a KYC link to create a user, unlock rails for a user, or submit KYC for a user.

This endpoint allows you to generate a HIFI-hosted KYC link that can be shared with users to collect their KYC information. The collected data can be used for User Creation, KYC Submission, or unlocking KYC rails for the user.

post.description:
**Pre-requisite:** You must pass KYC for the `MULTI_CURRENCY_ACCOUNT` rails before applying for a Currency Account.

Apply for a Currency Account to deposit fiat into a user's Multi-Currency Account.

Users can apply for and open a Currency Account for different currencies and bank locations. A Currency account functions as a virtual bank account designed solely to facilitate fund deposits 
into the Multi-Currency Account. It does not hold any funds itself, as all funds are held in the Multi-Currency Account.

See the Pay-in Currency & Region Support [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/currencies-by-bank-location).

post.description:
An offramp facilitates the conversion of crypto to fiat. Once the crypto transfer is confirmed, HIFI will deposit the converted fiat into the receiving user’s bank account. 

There are two types of offramp:

* **Quote-based offramp**: This type of offramp first returns the conversion rate quote based on the best market rate, which you can accept through the [Accept an offramp quote] endpoint to initiate the offramp.  
 To learn more about quote-based onramps, click [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/api-offramp).

* **Non-quote-based offramp**: This type of offramp will be initiated immediately upon creating an offramp.

get.description: Returns a list of offramps associated with a user under your organization. The offramps are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent offramps appearing first.
Retrieves an offramp.

post.description:
Accept and initiate a quote-based offramp.

For example, an offramp from crypto currency `usdc` to fiat currency `brl` is quote-based so its initial status will be `OPEN_QUOTE`. After reviewing the offramp conversion rate quote information, you can accept it to initialize the offramp.

get.description: Offramp rates are estimated rates for offramp conversions from different cryptocurrencies on different networks into all the different fiat currencies.

post.description: Accept a swap request to execute the cryptocurrency exchange.

An onramp facilitates the conversion of fiat to crypto. Once the fiat payment is received, HIFI will deliver the converted crypto to the receiving user’s wallet.

There are two types of onramp:

* **Quote-based onramp**: This type of onramp first returns the conversion rate quote based on the best market rate, which you can accept through the [Accept an onramp quote] endpoint to initiate the onramp.  
  Additionally, you can also refresh the onramp quote using the [Refresh an onramp quote] endpoint to refresh the conversion rate associated with the onramp. To learn more about quote-based onramps, click [here](https://docs.hifibridge.com/v2/docs/api-onramp).

* **Non-quote-based onramp**: This type of onramp will be initiated immediately upon creating an onramp.

get.description: Returns a list of onramps associated with a user under your organization. The onramps are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent onramps appearing first.
Retrieves an onramp.

post.description:
Accept a quote-based onramp.

For example, an onramp from fiat currency `brl` to crypto currency `usdc` is quote-based so its initial status will be `OPEN_QUOTE`. After reviewing the onramp conversion rate quote information, you can accept it to initialize the onramp.
Refresh the conversion rate quote that is associated with a quote-based onramp. You can only refresh an onramp quote with the status `OPEN_QUOTE`.

get.description: Onramp rates are estimated rates for onramp conversions from different fiat currencies into different cryptocurrencies.
